ygData.subject: SimpleOCR / Law of diminishing returns
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, I did a run with my SimpleOCR experiment overnight and the result is a good example of diminishing returns. A genome with 100% sucess rate(26/26) was found

Hi,

I did a run with my SimpleOCR experiment overnight and the result is a 
good example of diminishing returns. A genome with 100% sucess 
rate(26/26) was found after 7 hrs. However the max fitness in the 
population was 25/26 after only 74 mins. Actually this is a little 
better than the results I published in my phased search write up, so 
maybe some recent bug fixes have had a positive impact or maybe it's 
just a one-off result.

To clarify, this is an experiment with 26 input bitmaps of size 7x9 (=63 
inputs) which together present images of the 26 lower case letters of 
the alphabet to the network.  Hence there are 26 outputs for the network 
to indicate which bitmap it thinks it is being shown.

Colin.
